graph.basic

Class DMGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.basic.DMGraph
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    KNNGraph

    public class DMGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    This class offers one simple graph implementation that can be used in analysis and visualization. The latter is also the reason why a JGraph object is associated with a DMGraph object which essentially provides a data model to the former in cases of visualization. Vertices are represented via a DataSet object. This implementation is used mostly to analyze small networks and visualize them and is not meant for large-scale data analysis. Graph analysis is not the focus of this library.

      • DMGraph

        public DMGraph(java.lang.String networkName,
       java.lang.String networkDescription,
       DataSet vertices,
       DMGraphEdge[] edges)
        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        networkName - String that is the name of the modeled network.
        networkDescription - String that is the description of the modeled network.
        vertices - DataSet representing graph vertices. Each DataInstance is a vertex in the graph.
        edges - DMGraphEdge array of graph edges.

    • Method Detail

      • size

      • rescale

        public void rescale(double factor)
        Rescale the vertex sizes.
        Parameters:
        factor - Double that is the factor to rescale the vertices by.

      • merge

        public DMGraph merge(DMGraph g)
        Merges this graph with another one. However, this method changes both of these graphs along the way! This is because it changes some of the elements that are now contained in the merged graph, so this changes the references in both of the original graphs as well. If this is unacceptable, copies should be made and merged instead.
        Parameters:
        g - DMGraph to merge this one with.
        Returns:
        DMGraph that is the result of merging two graphs.
